definition: to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
variant of 萎靡不振[wei3 mi3 bu4 zhen4]

sentences.english: I was too tired to be active. And it did comfort me greatly seeing Zhihui there .
sentences.chinese: 結果是我精神不振，但看到志慧時的確覺得很溫馨。

sentences.english: Either way the original team will be slighted and dispirited by this ?
sentences.chinese: 無論是原有的團隊將輕視和本不振呢？

sentences.english: At twenty-two I am utterly worn out and finished.
sentences.chinese: 二十二歲，我已經絕對是一撅不振，完蛋了。

sentences.english: He cites the pork industry, which used to be blighted with hog cholera.
sentences.chinese: 他列舉了曾因豬霍亂而萎靡不振的養豬業。

sentences.english: During the middle ages, Greek civilization declined and became effete.
sentences.chinese: 中世紀，古希臘文明開始衰落，一蹶不振。

sentences.english: Hot weather can steal away your appetite.
sentences.chinese: 炎熱的天氣會讓你食慾不振。

sentences.english: It's a pity that someone will never stand up after a failure.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是有些人遭到失敗後一蹶不振。
天這麼熱，我變得委靡不振了。

sentences.english: Thus, another element of decay was introduced into Chiang's power.
sentences.chinese: 它成了使蔣政權一蹶不振的一個新因素。

sentences.english: They always look in low spirits, easy ageing.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是看起來精神不振，容易衰老。

sentences.english: We were wilting under the burning sun.
sentences.chinese: 我們在烈日下變得萎靡不振。

sentences.english: But US's dairying henceforth has not been unable to recover in these events.
sentences.chinese: 但美國的乳業並沒有在這些事件中從此一蹶不振。

sentences.english: So, Cicero first warned us against the danger of being lackadaisical .
sentences.chinese: 西塞羅首先警告我們要注意萎靡不振的危險。
食慾不振，上腹部有不適感。

definition: one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
variant of 萎靡不振[wei3 mi3 bu4 zhen4]
